news.title: Blow to Maria Steen’s Irish presidential hopes as Independent Ireland TDs hold back support
news.summary: Conservative activist Maria Steen suffered a major blow to her ­presidential hopes last night, just hours after announcing on the plinth at Leinster House that she had 10 Oireachtas backers and that her campaign was under way.

news.title: Conor McGregor not expected to face prosecution in alleged perjury inquiry
news.summary: Conor McGregor is not expected to face prosecution as part of a criminal inquiry into allegations of perjury related to his civil rape appeal.

news.title: Gardaí arrest man (40s) as part of investigation into Creeslough explosion
news.summary: A man in his 40s has been arrested as part of the investigation into the fatal explosion in Creeslough, Co Donegal in October 2022.

news.title: Bord Gáis announces huge rise in electricity prices
news.summary: More energy companies are to hike electricity prices, despite the largest player in the market committing to leaving its electricity prices unchanged.

news.title: Tenant living in €3,500 a month Dublin city apartment ordered to pay almost €70,000 in rent arrears
news.summary: A tenant renting an apartment in Dublin city centre has been ordered to vacate the property and pay nearly €70,000 in arrears.

news.title: Charlie Kirk shooting: Footage released of suspect fleeing roof as manhunt for killer pushes into third day
news.summary: The sniper who killed the conservative activist Charlie Kirk was still on the loose on Friday even as investigators flooded the internet with photos and video of a man believed to have carried out Wednesday's politically charged killing at a Utah university.

news.title: Who is Maria Steen? Conservative campaigner and mum-of-five who home-schools her children and voted ‘No’ in abortion and equality referenda
news.summary: Conservative campaigner Maria Steen, who is known for her recent role in pushing back against the failed family and care referendums, is making inroads to appearing on the presidential ballot. But it is likely to be an uphill battle for her.

news.title: Netherlands follows RTÉ and says it will pull out of Eurovision if Israel takes part
news.summary: The Netherlands is the latest country to say it will not participate in the 2026 Eurovision if Israel is allowed to compete.

news.title: Meet the Clare couple breathing new life into village hotel which was closed for three years – ‘The support has been unbelievable’
news.summary: A North Clare hotel and restaurant has re-opened under new management after being closed to the public for three years, bringing with it a wave of goodwill from locals looking to chip in to ensure the owners have all the help they need to get the doors open again.

news.title: Massive boost for Ireland as Aoife Wafer to make World Cup debut in quarter-final clash with France
news.summary: Aoife Wafer has been named in the Ireland team for the World Cup quarter-final against France at Sandy Park, Exeter on Sunday (1pm kick-off).
